pull.title: [Qt] add expert section to wallet tab in optionsdialog
pull.body:
...dialog

See title.
I think its better to move the "confusing" spendZeroConfChange in an "Expert" tab.
Coin control is misplaced in "Display" tab currently, in my opinion. So moving it too.

![experttab](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2814559/2391873/7f093562-a96f-11e3-8be1-4fac06e978d3.png)

events.body:
I think we should have an 'expert' section in the Wallet tab, and move these options there.

At least personally I don't like 'Expert' as a category in itself, it's not descriptive.
Ok, so closing this. I will keep the expert section in the wallet tab in mind.
Another way that would be ok to me is the other way around; keep this Expert tab and create a Wallet category there.

@laanwj What do you think? Moved the description for spendzeroconfchange to tooltip.

![experttab3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2814559/2436252/34eed104-add8-11e3-8f96-52d2359fb479.png)

issue.title: Change "Spend unconfirmed change" option text from "experts only" to "recommended".
issue.body:
This is a simple user-friendliness fix.  The text of the "spend unconfirmed change" option is misleading.  It currently reads this way:

```
 Spend unconfirmed change (experts only)
```

That implies that this option should only be selected if the user is an "expert" and non-expert users are seemingly warned not to select this option.  But in fact, that's the opposite of what the developers intended, because the intention was to recommend that users keep it selected.  So to communicate that to users, the text should actually be something like this:

```
 Spend unconfirmed change (recommended)
```

This makes it clear that it's recommending that the user keep the option checked.  The text "recommended" is also less jarring to novice users than the ominous tone of "experts only", which implies possible grave consequences.

comments.body: Be carefull to not dup names, you can try to just use `verticalSpacer` perhaps.
I have not dup names. This is just git diff. verticalSpacer_Display gets removed below and added here:)
